meanings.definition: The quality or state of being slightly acidic.
meanings.sent1: The subacidnesses of the lemon made my mouth pucker.
meanings.sent2: I could taste the subacidnesses of the vinegar in the salad dressing.
meanings.sent3: The subacidnesses of the orange juice added a tangy twist to the drink.
meanings.sent4: Her words had a subacidnesses that left a bitter aftertaste in the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The subacidnesses of the tomato gave the dish a refreshing zing.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of having a slightly acidic taste.
meanings.sent1: The subacidnesses of the yogurt complemented the sweetness of the fruit.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy the subacidnesses of the green apple over the red one.
meanings.sent3: The subacidnesses of the wine made her lips pucker in surprise.
meanings.sent4: His humor had a subacidnesses that left us laughing with a sour taste.
meanings.sent5: The subacidnesses of the pineapple added a delightful tang to the dish.
